FR: Il était une fois un meunier qui vivait pauvrement,
EN: There was once a miller who was poor,
GENERATED_EN: Once upon a time there was a miller who lived in poverty,

FR: mais dont la fille était fort belle.
EN: but he had one beautiful daughter.
GENERATED_EN: but whose daughter was very beautiful.

FR: Or il arriva un jour que le meunier eut à parler au roi,
EN: It happened one day that he came to speak with the king,
GENERATED_EN: One day, the miller had to talk to the king,

FR: pour se donner de l'importance,
EN: to give himself consequence,
GENERATED_EN: to make himself look important,

FR: lui dit: J'ai une fille capable de filer la paille et d'en tirer du fil d'or pur.
EN: he told him that he had a daughter who could spin gold out of straw.
GENERATED_EN: said to him: I have a daughter capable of spinning straw into pure gold thread.

FR: Voilà un art qui me plait, dit le roi;
EN: The king said to the miller: That is an art that pleases me well;
GENERATED_EN: Here is an art which pleases me, said the king;

FR: et si ta fille est aussi habile que tu le dis,
EN: if thy daughter is as clever as you say,
GENERATED_EN: and if your daughter is as skilled as you say she is

FR: conduis-la demain au château que je la voie à l'oeuvre.
EN: bring her to my castle to-morrow, that I may put her to the proof.
GENERATED_EN: bring her to the castle tomorrow and let me see her at work.

FR: Le lendemain, quand la jeune fille fut devant lui,
EN: When the girl was brought to him,
GENERATED_EN: The next day, when the girl was in front of him,

FR: le roi la conduisit aussitôt dans une pièce toute emplie de paille,
EN: he led her into a room that was quite full of straw,
GENERATED_EN: the king led her at once into a room full of straw,

FR: lui montra le rouet,
EN: and gave her a wheel and spindle,
GENERATED_EN: showed her the spinning wheel,

FR: et lui dit: A présent, au travail!
EN: and said: Now set to work,
GENERATED_EN: and said to her: "Now get to work!

FR: Et si d'ici demain matin tu ne m'as pas filé en or toute cette paille, il te faudra mourir!
EN: and if by the early morning thou hast not spun this straw to gold thou shalt die.
GENERATED_EN: And if by tomorrow morning you have not spun all this straw into gold, you must die!

FR: Le roi s'en alla sur ces mots, ferma lui-même la porte sur elle et la laissa seule.
EN: And he shut the door himself, and left her there alone.
GENERATED_EN: With these words, the king went away, closed the door on her himself and left her alone.

FR: La malheureuse fille pensa qu'elle était perdue
EN: And so the poor miller's daughter was left there sitting, and could not think what to do for her life:
GENERATED_EN: The unfortunate girl thought she was lost

FR: car elle ignorait tout d'un art qui eût permit de filer de l'or avec de la paille.
EN: she had no notion how to set to work to spin gold from straw,
GENERATED_EN: for she knew nothing of an art that would have allowed her to spin gold from straw.

FR: Alors, elle se mit à pleurer;
EN: and her distress grew so great that she began to weep.
GENERATED_EN: Then she began to cry;

FR: soudain, la porte s'ouvrit
EN: Then all at once the door opened,
GENERATED_EN: suddenly, the door opened

FR: et un petit lutin entra en disant:
EN: and in came a little man, who said:
GENERATED_EN: and a small imp entered while saying:

FR: Bonsoir, mademoiselle la meunière.
EN: Good evening, miller's daughter;
GENERATED_EN: Good evening, miss miller.

FR: Pourquoi pleures-tu tellement?
EN: why are you crying?
GENERATED_EN: Why are you crying so much?

FR: Hélas! lui répondit la jeune fille,
EN: Oh! answered the girl,
GENERATED_EN: Alas!" said the girl,

FR: il faut que je file de l'or avec de la paille
EN: I have got to spin gold out of straw,
GENERATED_EN: I have to spin gold with straw

FR: et je n'y connais rien.
EN: and I don't understand the business.
GENERATED_EN: and I don't know anything about it.

FR: Si je la file pour toi, qu'est-ce que tu me donnes? demanda le lutin.
EN: Then the little man said: What will you give me if I spin it for you?
GENERATED_EN: If I spin it for you, what will you give me?

FR: Mon collier, offrit-elle.
EN: My necklace, said the girl.
GENERATED_EN: My necklace, she offered.

FR: Le petit homme prit le collier,
EN: The little man took the necklace,
GENERATED_EN: The little man took the necklace,

FR: s'assit au rouet
EN: seated himself before the wheel,
GENERATED_EN: sat down at the spinning wheel

FR: et bss, bss, bss, en trois tours, la bobine était pleine.
EN: and whirr, whirr, whirr! three times round and the bobbin was full;
GENERATED_EN: and bss, bss, bss, in three turns, the spool was full.

FR: Il en remit une autre
EN: then he took up another,
GENERATED_EN: He put another one on

FR: et bss, bss, bss, en trois tours, la voilà pleine aussi;
EN: and whirr, whirr, whirr! three times round, and that was full;
GENERATED_EN: and bss, bss, bss, in three turns, it was full too;

FR: alors une autre, une autre, et ainsi de suite jusqu'au matin,
EN: and so he went on till the morning,
GENERATED_EN: then another, another, and so on until the morning,

FR: si bien que toute la paille était filée
EN: when all the straw had been spun,
GENERATED_EN: so that all the straw was spun

FR: et que la chambre était pleine de fil d'or.
EN: and all the bobbins were full of gold.
GENERATED_EN: and the room was full of golden thread.

FR: Le soleil se levait à peine, que déjà arrivait le roi;
EN: At sunrise came the king,
GENERATED_EN: The sun had hardly risen when the king arrived;

FR: il vit la chambre emplie de tout cet or,
EN: and when he saw the gold
GENERATED_EN: he saw the room filled with all this gold,

FR: s'en étonna bien et s'en réjouit plus encore,
EN: he was astonished
GENERATED_EN: was astonished by it and rejoiced even more,

FR: mais sans trop le montrer,
EN: and very much rejoiced,
GENERATED_EN: but without showing it too much,

FR: car son coeur était toujours avide d'or.
EN: for he was very avaricious.
GENERATED_EN: because his heart was always greedy for gold.

FR: Il fit amener la fille du meunier dans une autre chambre pleine de paille,
EN: He had the miller's daughter taken into another room filled with straw,
GENERATED_EN: He had the miller's daughter taken to another room full of straw,

FR: mais celle-là était bien plus vaste que la première,
EN: but this one was much larger than the first,
GENERATED_EN: but this one was much larger than the first,

FR: et il lui ordonna de tout filer avant le lever du jour si elle voulait avoir la vie sauve.
EN: and told her that as she valued her life she must spin it all in one night.
GENERATED_EN: and he ordered her to get out before daybreak if she wanted to live.

FR: Se sachant perdue et ne voyant aucun moyen de se sauver,
EN: The girl did not know what to do,
GENERATED_EN: Knowing she was lost and seeing no way to save herself

FR: la pauvre fondit de nouveau en larmes,
EN: so she began to cry,
GENERATED_EN: the poor one burst into tears again,

FR: et de nouveau la porte s'ouvrit, le petit lutin apparut en disant:
EN: and then the door opened, and the little man appeared and said:
GENERATED_EN: and again the door opened, the little elf appeared and said:

FR: Qu'est-ce que tu me donnes, si je file de l'or avec toute cette paille à ta place?
EN: What will you give me if I spin all this straw into gold?
GENERATED_EN: What do you give me, if I spin gold with all this straw in your place?

FR: La bague que j'ai au doigt. offrit la jeune fille.
EN: The ring from my finger, answered the girl.
GENERATED_EN: The ring that I have on my finger. offered the girl.

FR: Le petit homme prit la bague
EN: So the little man took the ring,
GENERATED_EN: The little man took the ring

FR: et se mit au rouet, bss, bss, bss,
EN: and began again to send the wheel whirring round,
GENERATED_EN: and started spinning, bss, bss, bss,

FR: et le matin, il ne restait plus de paille et tout était plein de fil d'or.
EN: and by the next morning all the straw was spun into glistening gold.
GENERATED_EN: and in the morning, there was no straw left and everything was full of gold thread.

FR: Quand il le vit, le roi en fut réjoui au delà de toute mesure,
EN: The king was rejoiced beyond measure at the sight,
GENERATED_EN: When he saw it, the king was delighted beyond measure,

FR: mais sa soif de l'or n'était toujours pas satisfaite,
EN: but as he could never have enough of gold,
GENERATED_EN: but his thirst for gold was still not satisfied,

FR: et il fit conduire la fille du meunier dans une nouvelle chambre bien plus grande encore et toute emplie de paille.
EN: he had the miller's daughter taken into a still larger room full of straw,
GENERATED_EN: and he had the miller's daughter taken to a new room, much larger still and full of straw.

FR: Cette fois, il lui dit: Tu dois encore me filer tout cela dans la nuit,
EN: and said: This, too, must be spun in one night,
GENERATED_EN: This time he said to her: "You must spin all this again during the night,

FR: et si tu y parviens, tu seras mon épouse.
EN: and if you accomplish it you shall be my wife.
GENERATED_EN: and if you succeed, you will be my wife.

FR: Et le roi s'en alla en se disant: Toute fille de meunier qu'elle soit,
EN: For he thought: Although she is but a miller's daughter,
GENERATED_EN: And the king went away, saying to himself, "Though she be a miller's daughter

FR: je ne pourrais pas trouver une femme plus riche dans le monde entier.
EN: I am not likely to find any one richer in the whole world.
GENERATED_EN: I could not find a richer woman in all the world.

FR: Dès que la jeune fille se trouva seule, le lutin réapparut pour la troisième fois et lui demanda:
EN: As soon as the girl was left alone, the little man appeared for the third time and said:
GENERATED_EN: As soon as the girl was alone, the imp appeared for the third time and asked her:

FR: Qu'est-ce que tu me donnes si je file la paille pour toi?
EN: What will you give me if I spin the straw for you this time?
GENERATED_EN: What will you give me if I spin straw for you?

FR: Je n'ai plus rien que je puisse te donner! dit la jeune fille.
EN: I have nothing left to give, answered the girl.
GENERATED_EN: I don't have anything left that I can give you!

FR: Alors promets-moi, quand tu seras reine, de me donner ton premier enfant.
EN: Then you must promise me the first child you have after you are queen, said the little man.
GENERATED_EN: Then promise me, when you are queen, to give me your first child.

FR: Qui sait ce qu'il adviendra de tout cela , pensa la fille du meunier.
EN: But who knows whether that will happen? thought the girl;
GENERATED_EN: Who knows what will happen to all this, thought the miller's daughter.

FR: Et comme elle ne voyait pas d'autre moyen de se sortir de cette situation,
EN: but as she did not know what else to do in her necessity,
GENERATED_EN: And as she could see no other way out of this situation,

FR: la jeune fille n'hésita pas très longtemps et promit son premier enfant au lutin, puisqu'il le voulait.
EN: she promised the little man what he desired,
GENERATED_EN: the girl didn't hesitate very long and promised her first child to the elf, since he wanted it.

FR: Et le petit homme s'installa au rouet
EN: upon which he began to spin,
GENERATED_EN: And the little man settled down at the spinning wheel

FR: et fila une fois de plus toute la paille en or.
EN: until all the straw was gold.
GENERATED_EN: and spun all the straw into gold once more.

FR: Le lendemain matin, quand le roi vint et constata que tout était filé en or, ainsi qu'il l'avait souhaité,
EN: And when in the morning the king came and found all done according to his wish,
GENERATED_EN: The next morning, when the king came and saw that everything was spun into gold, as he had wished,

FR: il fit préparer les noces
EN: he caused the wedding to be held at once,
GENERATED_EN: he made the wedding preparations

FR: et la jolie meunière devint reine.
EN: and the miller's pretty daughter became a queen.
GENERATED_EN: and the pretty miller became queen.

FR: Un an plus tard, elle mettait au monde un beau garçon, sans guère se soucier de la promesse qu'elle avait pu faire au lutin,
EN: In a year's time she brought a fine child into the world,
GENERATED_EN: A year later, she gave birth to a handsome boy, not caring about the promise she had made to the elf,

FR: car en vérité elle n'y pensait même plus.
EN: and thought no more of the little man;
GENERATED_EN: because in truth she didn't even think about it anymore.

FR: Mais il entra soudain dans sa chambre et lui dit:
EN: but one day he came suddenly into her room, and said:
GENERATED_EN: But he suddenly entered her room and said:

FR: Je viens chercher ce que tu m'as promis.
EN: Now give me what you promised me.
GENERATED_EN: I've come for what you promised me.

FR: La reine en fut horrifiée
EN: The queen was terrified greatly,
GENERATED_EN: The queen was horrified

FR: et supplia le petit homme de lui laisser son enfant en lui offrant toutes les richesses du royaume.
EN: and offered the little man all the riches of the kingdom if he would only leave the child;
GENERATED_EN: and begged the little man to leave her child with all the riches of the kingdom.

FR: Non, lui répondit-il,
EN: but the little man said:
GENERATED_EN: No," he answered,

FR: un être vivant m'est infiniment plus précieux que tous les trésors du monde.
EN: No, I would rather have something living than all the treasures of the world.
GENERATED_EN: a living being is infinitely more precious to me than all the treasures of the world.

FR: La reine se mit à pleurer et à gémir tant et tant,
EN: Then the queen began to lament and to weep,
GENERATED_EN: The queen began to weep and wail so and so,

FR: à la fin, le petit homme en eut pitié et lui dit: Je te laisse trois jours;
EN: so that the little man had pity upon her. I will give you three days, said he,
GENERATED_EN: at the end, the little man took pity on her and said: I leave you three days;

FR: si tu connais mon nom d'ici là,
EN: and if at the end of that time you cannot tell my name,
GENERATED_EN: if you know my name by then,

FR: tu garderas ton enfant.
EN: you must give up the child to me.
GENERATED_EN: you will keep your child.

FR: Alors la reine se mit à réfléchir et passa la nuit à se remémorer tous les noms possibles et à chercher ceux qu'elle ne connaissait pas, tous les noms qu'elle n'avait jamais entendus;
EN: Then the queen spent the whole night in thinking over all the names that she had ever heard,
GENERATED_EN: So the queen began to think and spent the night recalling all the possible names and looking for those she did not know, all the names she had never heard;

FR: et le lendemain matin, elle envoya vite un messager courir le pays pour apprendre tous les noms qu'il pouvait y avoir encore.
EN: and sent a messenger through the land to ask far and wide for all the names that could be found.
GENERATED_EN: and the next morning, she quickly sent a messenger to run around the country to learn all the names that might still be there.

FR: Le soir, quand le lutin vint la voir,
EN: And when the little man came next day,
GENERATED_EN: In the evening, when the elf came to see her

FR: elle commença par Melchior, Gaspard et Balthazar,
EN: beginning with Caspar, Melchior, Balthazar
GENERATED_EN: she began with Melchior, Gaspard and Balthazar,

FR: puis continua à lui énumérer dans l'ordre tous les noms qu'elle connaissait et tous ceux qu'elle avait pu apprendre;
EN: she repeated all she knew, and went through the whole list,
GENERATED_EN: then continued to list in order all the names she knew and all those she had learned;

FR: mais à chacun le lutin répondait:
EN: but after each the little man said:
GENERATED_EN: but to each one the elf answered:

FR: Non, ce n'est pas mon nom.
EN: That is not my name.
GENERATED_EN: No, that's not my name.

FR: Le lendemain, qui était le deuxième jour de son délai, la reine fit demander plus loin dans le voisinage comment s'appelaient les gens de ces provinces-là;
EN: The second day the queen sent to inquire of all the neighbours what the servants were called,
GENERATED_EN: The next day, which was the second day of her delay, the queen asked further in the neighborhood what the people of those provinces were called;

FR: et elle soumit au lutin des noms bizarres et extraordinaires.
EN: and told the little man all the most unusual
GENERATED_EN: and she submitted to the imp strange and extraordinary names.

FR: Mais toujours il lui répondait: Non, je ne m'appelle pas ainsi.
EN: But he answered nothing but: That is not my name.
GENERATED_EN: But he always answered her: "No, I am not called that.

FR: Le troisième et dernier jour, le messager revint et dit à la reine:
EN: The third day the messenger came back again, and said:
GENERATED_EN: On the third and last day, the messenger returned and said to the queen:

FR: Je n'ai pu découvrir aujourd'hui un seul nom nouveau;
EN: I have not been able to find one single new name;
GENERATED_EN: I could not discover today a single new name;

FR: mais comme j'étais arrivé à une haute montagne tout là-bas,
EN: but as I passed through the woods I came to a high hill,
GENERATED_EN: but as I had arrived at a high mountain over there,

FR: à la lisière de la forêt où le lièvre et le renard se disent Bonne nuit!
EN: but this one was much larger than the first,
GENERATED_EN: at the edge of the forest where the hare and the fox say good night!

FR: j'ai aperçu soudain une toute petite maison;
EN: and near it was a little house,
GENERATED_EN: I suddenly saw a very small house;

FR: et devant la maison il y avait un feu qui brûlait;
EN: and before the house burned a fire,
GENERATED_EN: and in front of the house there was a fire burning;

FR: et devant ce feu, il y avait un drôle de petit bonhomme
EN: and round the fire danced a comical little man,
GENERATED_EN: and in front of this fire, there was a funny little man

FR: qui dansait en sautant sur une seule jambe et qui chantait:
EN: and he hopped on one leg and cried:
GENERATED_EN: who was dancing, jumping on one leg and singing:

FR: Je fais cuire aujourd'hui,
EN: Today do I bake,
GENERATED_EN: I cook today,

FR: demain je brasserai
EN: tomorrow I brew,
GENERATED_EN: tomorrow I will brew

FR: Et l'enfant de la reine après-demain j'aurai.
EN: The day after that the queen's child comes in;
GENERATED_EN: And the queen's child the day after tomorrow I will have.

FR: Ah! qu'il est bon que nul ne sache
EN: And oh! I am glad that nobody knew
GENERATED_EN: Oh, how good it is that no one knows

FR: Que je m'appelle Outroupistache!
EN: That the name I am called is Rumpelstiltskin!
GENERATED_EN: That my name is Outroupistache!

FR: Vous pouvez imaginer combien la reine fut contente en entendant ce nom.
EN: You cannot think how pleased the queen was to hear that name,
GENERATED_EN: You can imagine how happy the queen was when she heard this name.

FR: Et quand un peu plus tard, le petit homme entra et demanda:
EN: and soon afterwards, when the little man walked in and said:
GENERATED_EN: And when a little later, the little man entered and asked:

FR: Eh bien, Madame la reine, quel est mon nom?
EN: Now, Mrs. Queen, what is my name?
GENERATED_EN: Well, Madam Queen, what is my name?

FR: elle commença par lui demander: Ne t'appelles-tu pas Jack?
EN: she said at first Are you called Jack?
GENERATED_EN: she began by asking him: Is your name not Jack?

FR: Non.
EN: No, answered he.
GENERATED_EN: No.

FR: Ou Paul peut-être?
EN: Are you called Harry? she asked again.
GENERATED_EN: Or Paul, perhaps?

FR: Non.
EN: No, answered he.
GENERATED_EN: No.

FR: Ou alors est-ce que ce ne serait pas, qui sait, Outroupistache?
EN: Then perhaps your name is Rumpelstiltskin?
GENERATED_EN: Or would it be, who knows, Outroupistache?

FR: C'est le diable qui te l'a dit!
EN: The devil told you that!
GENERATED_EN: The devil told you that!

FR: C'est le diable qui te l'a dit!
EN: the devil told you that!
GENERATED_EN: The devil told you that!

FR: hurla le petit homme.
EN: cried the little man,
GENERATED_EN: shouted the little man.

FR: Et, dans sa rage, il tapa du pied si fort qu'il s'enfonça dans le sol jusqu'à la hanche;
EN: and in his anger he stamped with his right foot so hard that it went into the ground above his knee;
GENERATED_EN: And in his rage he stamped his foot so hard that it sank into the ground up to his hip;

FR: alors il saisit son pied à deux mains et, fou de fureur, tira dessus avec tant de force qu'il s'ouvrit le corps en deux.
EN: then he seized his left foot with both his hands in such a fury that he split in two,
GENERATED_EN: then he seized his foot with both hands and, mad with fury, pulled on it with so much force that he opened his body in two.

FR: et c'en était fini de lui.
EN: and there was an end of him.
GENERATED_EN: and it was finished of him.
